Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Tally O
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Berlin Mitte for one night on business. I have previously stayed at a NH hotel in Madrid, which was exceptional, and thus had high expectations of the NH Mitte. Though the receptionist on check-in was a little abrupt, I was upgraded to a room on the 7th floor as there were no more standard rooms left, and moreover my request for a quiet room was kindly honoured: I was given a room facing into the inner courtyard, which while there was no view, had essentially no traffic noise. With a closed window, the room was completely quiet, and I had a wonderful night's sleep. There is a complimentary gym on the 8th (top) floor (though did not use it): it has a couple of trendmills, dumbbells up to 20kg and an 'adjustable height' cable crossover machine. So not too impressive, but then again German hotels in general don't seem to have cottoned on to the idea that their clients may want to stay in shape while on travel. Check out was also a little slow: there was a long line of people waiting to check in and out and not enough desk clerks. It would be nicer if one could prepay on arrival, to save time on exit, but then the NH wants the opportunity to sell you all the extras during your stay i.e. minibar, Internet (free in the lobby but not in the rooms), and breakfast (21 euros (there are plenty of cafes outside)). The NH merits the 5 stars nonetheless because of the excellent night's sleep, and at the end of the day, this is most fundamental when on business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keri M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a NH hotel previously which is the main reason why I booked this hotel in Berlin. I was not disappointed this time either. The room and bathroom were spotless (great powerful shower as well) and the bed was extremely comfortable, just what you need after all the walking around Berlin. The staff were pleasant and well mannered and offered great restaurant recommendations outwith the hotel. There is free wi-fi in the lobby for up to 30 mins which was the only downside as 1 hour would have been better. The location was ideal - a U-Bahn station is just around the corner and only a 5 min walk to Checkpoint Charlie. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Well equipped, centrally located, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Mceroni
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and well equipped. Bed was soft but surprisingly made for a good sleep. Breakfast was sumptuous but pricey at 20euros. Internet is charged. Wifi was free only for 30 mins in the lobby. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Fair place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Frank_and_Barbara
Reviews.Content: First time at NH Leipziger Str. Friendly staff, nice rooms, clean. Location is ok but there are others. Price very good, breakfast crowded but good selection. I like the shampoo at NH in Berlin. Check out could be faster, but staff ... again did a good job.

Reviews.Title: “I received what I payed for”
Reviews.Author: delfincek
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip from Berlin. I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. I liked it. Staff is very professional and very friendly. I think all the Berliners are very kind and professional people. Also I think it is a NH standard and they do their job remarkably good. They provided me with lots of details and served my needs when I asked for help. I was in a single room, but this is excellent room with a lot of space for single man and big bed. Bathroom is very clean and I like the soaps and shampoos which were provided there. Breakfast in the morning is good and you will have a chance to select from varieties of German sausages, salami, crispy, flakes, fruit, fruit salads, youghurt, also omelets are prepared directly in front of you if you like it. I did not do any sights as I was just for the conference but sure I would recommend to visit berlin in June, July or August as it is very warm and a nice please to explore. And if you like club life that is one of the best European city to be. Internet is free of charge only in the lobby, if you want to have in your room you need to pay. This is one of the thing that in the era of Internet should be improved and provided free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ken H
Reviews.Content: It's hard to beat the location of the NH Mitte. Very near the Metro, and easy walking distance to Unter den Linden, Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island, etc. Very nice, modern, up to date hotel. Well appointed, clean, spacious rooms and amenities. Fairly large, but it didn't seem out of control. Breakfast buffet was very good, but a bit pricey. We did that one day when we were really hungry. There were plenty of other alternatives nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good, reliable hotel with pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Rodster13
Reviews.Content: A great base for exploring Mitte and surrounding districts. A friendly, pleasant and efficient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: luckytravelersLI
Reviews.Content: Checked in at the NH Berlin Mitte Hotel. The first room they gave us smelled of smoke, but they quickly corrected the situation and gave us another room. The hotel has an excellent location. We could have taken the underground from TEGEL airport very easily.Next morning we had breakfast at the hotel . A pricey but awesome buffet. We did not need lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting business model”
Reviews.Author: Peter D
Reviews.Content: 4 star modern hotel for euro 65 per night off the Internet, but.... Euro 21 for breakfast, euro 15 to borrow power adapters, more euro for Internet outside of 30 minutes in the lobby. Service generally cold, except the guy at the information counter. No clocks in the room. Watching the near empty breakfast room as we left the hotel for a bakery breakfast, I wondered whether their business model is flawed.

Reviews.Title: “No Heating in the room be Careful”
Reviews.Author: Luaysaffar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location in perfect ,Room size small,Clean,new furniture ,No free Internet just in the lobby you can get for free with 30 Minutes limit . The big problem in this hotel which we faced for the second time is the heating in the room which was fixed at 21 C and you can not control it,the temperature control in the room is use lees you can control the fan speed only not the room temperature which was so so cold for us and we have to wear all what we have just to sleep well at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: francesco12376
Reviews.Content: We've been in this hotel for two days and half,and it was simply fantastic!nice rooms,lots of space,tidy and clean;amazing breakfast,friendly and professional staff;very well located in the Mitte quarter,near to some important places in Berlin.I would really reccomend to consider this hotel for a trip in Berlin!by the way,we paid a special fare,quite low,so this made the experience in the hotel fantastic.in any case,the hotel dire deserves the 4 stars superior cat!!!just a little tip:before dribbling the bottle of water in the room,check the price...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, warm, centrally located, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ph1ll3rs
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel twice (two New Year trips). The hotel is really central in Berlin and most attractions are only a 5/10 min walk. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. The staff were very friendly and only happy to help you. Unfortunately the bar was quiet and lacking in any atmosphere but there are many lively bars close by. Bar prices were also very high and some of our bar bills were in excess of €200 (for 6 persons). I think this will be similar in most hotels around this time of year. Food in the hotel was nice but a little over-priced. I would certainly reccommend staying in this hotel, especially over the New Year period. There is so much to do in Berlin that you will spend little time in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location near checkpoint charlie and b-gate”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoVirginia
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location near lots of the major sites that people go to see like Checkpoint Charlie and the Brandenburg Gate. While it's great to walk around alot of the sites can be a fair distance away, but the subways (u and S Bahn) are very easy to use, very safe and go everywhere. There is a U-Bahn station right around the corner from the hotel and even after a long flight it was very east to get a bus (from Tegel Airport) to the U-Bahn which takes you right to Stagmitte which is the stop closest to the hotel, 40 minutes tops from the airport to the hotel. The rooms are not particularly atmospheric but are clean. The lobby is large and if you need to arrange trips or other services, the concierge can handle it. The tour companies tend to use the NH hotels quite a bit, so the rooms can book up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Amateurish and uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: BennyF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Berlin Mitte for four nights in early September. We booked the hotel via Hotwire where it as listed as 4 1/2 star. That is not correct. The hotel lists itself as a four star hotel. On the surface it does look like a four star hotel. The lobby is nice and spacious and it seems clean. The garage under the hotel is nice. There are however a number of cons... At first we were given a room on the second floor. Entering the room was not a pleasant experience. The room was old, dark and dirty. The furniture was old and should have been changed years ago. They were all in dark colours and combined with a window that did not give much light to the room it was very dark and boring. The cleaning of the room was not good either. It was cleaned on the most obvious places but if you looked in the corners or beside the TV it was obvious it was amateurish. There were even flies laying by the window. It was awful and as my wife put it "we have stayed in IBIS-hotels that were a lot nicer" We went down to to the reception to complain. After som persuading they "upgraded" us to a "deluxe" room on the firth floor. The only difference between that room and the "standard" we were originally given was that this room had been renovovated not too long ago. It was the same size and the bath room looked exactly the same. Cleaing was still not good. This room I would say was good enough for a three star hotel. The "standard" room at best for a two star hotel. Anyway - having already paid the room for four night there was not much to do than to accept the room. The hotel is is i a great location and since we did not spend much time in the hotel anyway the state of the room did not matter that much. The hotel offered free wifi- in the lobby. However - I have not experience anything that slow since the 1990s... The check out was another nightmare. Having booked through Hotwire the room was obviously pre-paid. However the reception had no idea about this and wanted us to pay for the room there as well. About four people were involved from the hotel's side before they could finally admit they were wrong. So amateurish... I do no get angry easily but this time I got really upset because their lack of knowledge and unfriendly manner. Finally - when my wife brought up the subject of the cleaning when asked about if we liked our stay - the hotel staff said they were sorry but that it was not their own staff. I can't believe they blamed their poor cleaning on somebody they had hired to do this. Amateurish....

Reviews.Title: “If you like hot, stuffy rooms, this is the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: H2where
Reviews.Content: First the positives: the hotel is very eco-minded, which I appreciate. On to the negatives. Sleep is important to me. All I ask for is dark, quiet, and cool. This hotel managed dark okay, but it's noisy because of street traffic (so leaving windows open isn't an option if you prefer quiet,) and also noisy because you can hear other guests through the walls. As for cool -- forget it. The room was absolutely miserable! There is no air conditioning, but a fan -- however, the fan turns itself off after about 10 minutes. No matter what I did, the fan turned off and I woke up stifled & sweaty. (Remember that this is Europe, so there is no top sheet, just a heavy duvet.) I'd get up, turn on the fan, go to sleep, wake up sweaty an hour later, the air in the room stifling and heavy. Horrible! On top of that, the hotel was just cheap -- not in the sense of inexpensive, but in the sense of petty. Chocolates on the pillows on the first night, but never again in a week-long stay. There is no lotion or conditioner. They provided only one bottle of shampoo, one of shower gel, and one bar of soap and never replaced them, even when I ran out on day 3. Yes, I'm sure I could have called for more, but really -- why should I have to? And the worst offense of cheapness to me -- charging 18 euros for internet connection. Absurd.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Franchinii
Reviews.Content: Good place. No bad surprises. Good room, helpful staff, nice location and good price. For both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: louise c
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week in July 2011. The hotel is very modern and clean. It is a great location close by to checkpoint charlie,Brandenburg gate and all other major attractions. Me and my partner walked all over central Berlin. We found it particularly great that we could rent bikes at the hotel for a small fee. There is an information desk in the hotel that are very helpful if your looking for something in particular to do. Berlin is a place for people of any age, me and my partner are in our 20's and found loads to do in the day and the evening. Its a fantastic place! The rooms were throughly cleaned everyday. The only quibble about the room would be the pillows provided were lumpy and uncomfortable. Other than that a fantastic hotel and would recommend to anybody visiting Berlin. One tip: If you would like to visit the Reichstag you have to apply at least 5 days before you visit as they require security checks. Nevermind, We will have to visit again to see the Reichstag!

Reviews.Title: “HVAC horrible”
Reviews.Author: Rahwayan
Reviews.Content: Just complete a 4-day stay. As noted by other reviewers, location is good and breakfast buffet is better than average with a large variety. However, the HVAC system does not cool the room. Limited cool air came out and then after 30 minutes, would shut off completely. We had to continually get up to reset and start again and room never got cool. When I started to explain to front desk, they acknowledged this was a common complaint and that they'd have maintenance look at it. Nothing changed and we had a rather uncomfortable stay as the room was stuffy. Rooms are average, nothing special. Internet (30 minute free increments in lobby) was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: redrider53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of August 2011. It is centrally located within walking distance of numerous attractions ( Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg Gate, etc ). In Berlin, park your car and either walk or take the 100 series bus which takes you through all the main sites. The Hotel is located in the former East German side and has been totally renovated: it is clean, with spacious rooms and underground parking. The staff is very nice and the service is exceptional: one example is that, upon our return from a day's outing, we stopped at the Desk to request a few more pillows. A staff member was waiting for us at our room door with more pillows when we got off the elevator! They were also very quick in trying to fix a problem with the A/c in our room. The rooms are larger than the usual european accomodation. We did not have breakfast at the Hotel as we found 20 euros a tad steep for breakfast: but there are bakeries and restaurants all within meters of the Hotel for every kind of food possible from breakfast to supper. All in all, a very pleasant stay at the Hotel: a little pricier than outside the City but a great value considering the Central location and the ease of access to all main attractions in Berlin. Would definitely stay there again. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but really no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Steven J
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint about this hotel is that the central air conditioning is really just a fan. No cold air and I like it cold. And I chose this hotel over another because the other one had no air conditioning. I had to change rooms but found the second room no cooler. To their credit, the hotel provided me with a portable fan so that I could have moving air blown at me to help me sleep. Otherwise, the hotel is in a good location from where it is easy to get anywhere. The Stadmitte subway station is next to the hotel. Unfortunately, there is lots of upgrading of the subway system going on. So what should have been a one-train trip to the Olympic Stadium required three trains. Whatever - that is not the fault of the hotel. The breakfast buffet was included with my room and it was quite satisfying. I was able to go all day without eating anything else until dinnertime. As mentioned by others, free wi-fi access is only available in the lobby and it is provided in 30 minute increments. For each 30 minute session you must ask the receptionist for a code. At night the lobby is filled with folks on their computers and smartphones checking in online. The bed was very soft (I like it hard) and not flat and the pillows not very fluffy. So sleeping was not at all comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Large Hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TallTexWally
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the NH Berlin Mitte Hotel. It's a large hotel, located in the heart of Berlin, not far from Checkpoint Charlie. I had been traveling by train the last few days across Europe, from Rome, to Copenhagen, and then Berlin. This was a larger, and newer hotel than many of the hotels I had been staying at for the past week, so it was almost like a special treat to stay here. It wasn't within an easy walk from the Berlin Hauptbahnhof, but I was able to get here easily by taking the S-Bahn to Friedrichstrasse, and then the U-Bahn to Stadtmitte. The hotel was very close to the Stadmitte U-Bahn station. I had a good impression of this hotel, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A FAVOR, STAY AT AN OTHER HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: islandspapand
Reviews.Content: Before we decided to stay at this hotel we checked the hotels sites pictures and videos, to verify how the rooms looked. We called the hotel, because we read that you would get on-request a smoking superior room and we wanted to make sure that we could the same room that we saw in the video but smoking. They verified it every time we called(we wanted to be sure ). then we booked a (smoking) superior room with a queen bed. When we arrived we got a room that looked like death. It really looked like the 80s throw up in there. (Be careful they do not advise these rooms on their website 3th floor) We walked straight down and said that this was not the room we had booked and after a lot of bad communication they gave us and an other room that they said was a "junior suite" but on their web-video it was called a superior room. Now we finally could relax but find out it is a non-smoking. They claim to speak English but Jesus if we spoke German they wouldn't understand us. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. Once more we had to go down and complain but all they did was shrug their shoulders and to compensate they gave us free minibar and 2 drinks at the bar. Too cheap. We wanted what we had booked.We wanted our money back but that was not an option, otherwise we would have stayed at Adina apartments. The room; it looks nice but you sleep like crap the worst nights sleep I have ever had.My back hurt every morning. The sofas are rock hard and dirty underneath and between the pillows. We had to call the reception for bathrobes and when we got the they were dirty. On the balcony there were nothing, no chairs or table. The food from room service was terrible. The soup was okay and the most expensive dish Vienna schnitzel was awful. The rest stops have better food. Or use the pizzeria across the street original Italian pizzas and pastas. Wonderful food and cheap.The sauna was okay but some of the thing didn't work. For such a small "spa" that is unacceptable. We wanted to drive op to the schasenhausen concentration camp a hour out of Berlin so we went to the information desk to get an address. The woman in the information desk took a map out of the subway and pointed to the schasenhausen stop. I needed a address to for the gps but she just kept saying schasenhausen station. So i asked for the website address so i could find it myself. I don't now if everybody that works at that hotel just hate their job or if it is their lives they can't stand.So do YOURSELF a big favor and DON'T stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: ManWithSillyHat
Reviews.Content: well appointed and comfortable hotel set in the centre of Berlin. service was good and efficient, with an ample buffet breakfast which will certainly set you up for a days sight seeing. Spa facilities on the top floor offer exercise equip and a small sun-deck and a sauna - mixed and clothes free naturally. Small pizza restaurant opposite offers an excellent hand made pizza and a good cold weissbier should you feel the need for a cheap and local bite. hotel restaurant offers tasty and very well presented fare. there is a supermarket 2 blocks to the west in maurstrasse for those essentials and food for a days exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, excellent base to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sophie62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in July, from the outset, the hotel looked lovely, very big and spacious. You can even take your bar drinks and meals outside and sit out at front on the tables outside. The reception were fantastic and were able to help me out with free maps (as it was my first time in Berlin), and also I had realised that I didn't have a european plug convertor, so they lent me one from the desk to save me from having to buy one. It's an easy to walk to the main shopping areas and also just around the corner from the train station. There was no wifi in the rooms unless you pay for it, so you have to use the free wifi in the lobby which is time restricted, not a massive problem so long as you can type fast! The breakfast wasn't included in my room rate, but given the amount I was paying, I thought breakfast should have been included. At 179 euros a night, breakfast should come as part of that. Anyway, I had to pay an extra 21 euros for breakfast which I thought was pretty steep, but they do have a wide selection of hot and cold food and fruit at breakfast, and even a chef who can make omelettes and waffles to order... As a central hotel and international one, I should expect that they had more international TV channels in their rooms. Nearly all their channels in the rooms were German speaking apart from 1 English. I don't have a problem with the amount of German channels, after all, we're in Germany but as an international hotel, they should also be supplying Spanish, French, Italian etc channels. Overall it was a lovely stay, I think the price is rather dear considering breakfast is not included but the location is brilliant and the staff were all lovely.

Reviews.Title: “fancy but no extras”
Reviews.Author: lj241290
Reviews.Content: the hotel appears very fancy in the lobby and the restaurant also looks fancy but the restaurant doesn't have very nice food. There are no extras in the hotel such as free wifi in your room. you either need to pay a ridiculous amount to use it or go to the lobby where you get a 30min password and the internet is extremely slow. Breakfast is overpriced at 21euros per person per day the pillows weren't very comfortable and our queen bed had 2 separate blankets which was a little bit weird

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great price, best value for money”
Reviews.Author: guyfeller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights,the staff was very helpful,the location is good,near a central bahn metro station. breakfast pretty expensive, but overall it was great. we recommend! The feller's

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good room.”
Reviews.Author: travelexpert001
Reviews.Content: For ITB I wanted a hotel in Mitte however, by the time I booked most hotels were booked out and I ended up at the NH. It seems to be renovated and I had a good room and was very pleased with my stay overall. The breakfast buffet has lots of options and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Ajaxtraveler2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. It was within walking distance to many sites and the subway station was practically on the corner. The front desk staff were friendly and spoke very good english. The restaurant was pricey but the menu was is english. The mini post office in the lobby had one nasty young female that worked in the evening but other than her, the staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel That Can Strive to be Great”
Reviews.Author: JagsM
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for a 3 day weekend. Very convenient location in Berlin inner city, walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie, Unter den Linden, the Museum Insel, etc. Very professional, friendly and efficient front desk staff : I reached a couple of hours before normal check-in and got my room without any whining or them making a point about doing me a favour; the Info desk near the reception is usually helpful with tips on where to go and how (though on the last day when I asked about Sans Souci the girl on duty was clearly having an intellect challenge) and the rooms are clean. The things the hotel needs to work on are their pillows (and I see others on the site have also mentioned the same criticism) - pillows need more character guys, and not be so weak with no support (if I wanted a pillow like a relative I would have brought one along LOL). And the entrance area, with a very sad looking Berlin mascot bear, needs a bit sprucing up. It was neither welcoming nor clean (most un-Teuton like) everytime I went in. Otherwise a very good hotel and one I would go back to for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: varney
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, rooms are a good size and comfortable and modern, the hotel is reasonably large, there were some conferences on while we were there but the hotel didn't feel crowded. the breakfast selection was excellent. Service in the bar was good very helpful nothing too much effort. location is good for me it was a ten minute walk through checkpoint charlie to get to the office.

Reviews.Title: “Great: service, location, staff... everything”
Reviews.Author: djmccreedy
Reviews.Content: A very clean and comfortable hotel, in an excellent location (walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburg Gate etc). Staff were very friendly and polite, especially the reception staff. 30 min free internet in the lobby is also very much appreciated. Recommended for all travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay, wished I'd stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: TheConstantEater
Reviews.Content: I was only there for one night which didnt give me enough time to check it all out but from what we saw, it was terrific (and much better than the only other NH experience I have had). The room was fantastic, and the location was superb, close to Postsdamer Platz and Brandenburg Gate. And the mojitos in the bar did not disappoint either! I dont really know my way around Berlin yet, so will be back to explore it some more, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A REALLY LOVELY HOTEL ...”
Reviews.Author: magentamonster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Berlin Mitte for 4 nights with a friend in March 2011 and was totally satisfied and pleased with this really lovely hotel. Check-in and check-out was as smooth as silk. Staff at the reception and breakfast room were really efficient and friendly. The room was large, modern, clean and so comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and one is spoilt for choice. The fantastic location is also a big plus .... very central yet one cannot hear any noise in the room. I will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I'm in Berlin and will recommend it to anyone who wants quality and value in this wonderful city. Jesmond Alfino, Malta

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect breakfast and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Sol058
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend and a couple of friends spent 3 days in Berlin. Our stay at this hotel couldn't have been more perfect. When we arrived, the standard room we had booked wasn't available, so they immediatly gave us a superior room., which was perfectly clean and comfortable, modern and spacious. The location is great, walking distance from the main spots such us Check Point Charlie, and Brandenburg Gate. Breakfest was great, variety and quality. We made it till supper without lunch! Can't speak about price, we had a special rate.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible beds, bad customer service.”
Reviews.Author: jbidding
Reviews.Content: About the only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. If things like comfortable beds, amenities and decent customer service are important to you then keep looking. The bed was lumpy and the pillows are wafer thin. When we requested a room with a decent bed we were told we'd have to pay for an upgrade, despite the fact that it was Christmas day and the entire hotel was EMPTY. When we looked at the so-called "upgrade" it had a similar lumpy bed and wafer thin pillows.(Thanks, but no thanks.) The hallways have a terrible odor, the maid service never replaced our drinking glasses after the first night, the mediocre breakfast was overpriced at 21 euro (we've had similar breakfasts in London and Paris for 14 euro) and they charge for internet service (which is SO last century.) Also, the last time they replaced the television was in 1989. It almost seems like this place is trying to be a boutique hotel but is failing miserably. Most of the staff looked miserable and didn't seem to care if the hotel guests lived or died. Berlin is such a great city, but I dreaded returning to our hotel each night. I hated it and I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of the East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: snakebyte
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated: minutes of walking from Potsdam Platz, Unter der Linden, Checkpoint Charlie and Gedankirchte. The subway is about 200m away from the hotel. The rooms are nice, but the hotel has only 7 smoking rooms(and no space to smoke inside) Breakfast offers variate food. The only problem that i encountered was the weak GSM signal in the room

Reviews.Title: “comfy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ruber122
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfy and the service was excellent. When I called the front desk for extra toiletries, they brought it up right away. The rooms are in excellent condition. My room had hardwood floors and from experience, usually rooms with hardwood floors tend to get pretty chilly, but in this case, the room felt warm and quite cozy. The hotel is located, practically, right next to the underground railway, the Stadmitte station, which makes it easy access to get around Berlin. It is also just about 2-3 blocks away from Checkpoint Charlie and, if you are the type to enjoy walks, other tourist attractions are in walkable distance, such as, the Brandenburg Gate, Humboldt University and the many museums and memorials.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: novembre1965
Reviews.Content: Today I checked out of this hotel. The staff at the reception desk were very polite upon my arrival and ready to assist you. At 2.40pm the room was not yet ready, but the staff immediately stored my luggage. The location is great (very close to Freidrisch Strasse - the nicest street in Eastern Berlin - In less than 5 minutes, you are in the shopping area, including a Starbucks coffee (much cheaper than Madrid or Paris) - To get to Dussmann (a wonderful book and DVD store) takes 15 minute walk. Breakfast is simply superb (6am-10am). A large variety of breads, jams, including those made for people suffering diabetes, cereals, fruits and home-made cakes. Coffee is not that bad (in Germany it could be much worse). The hotel also offers wellness facilities and massages at €60 (one hour) Two minor shortcomings. The bottle of water (still, not even sparkling) in the room costs €7.90 (the second most expensive bottle of water after Moscow's) and the check in time is 3pm, which is quite late for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean, and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kensington35
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise to be able to stay in the middle of Berlin in a new hotel with very good service, cleanliness, comfortable beds, and great breakfast. Will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mrs_p81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location close to the U Bahn but also within walking distance of Potsdamer platz and Unter den Linten. We stayed her for 5 nights and found the hotel to be really good, modern with great service. Breakfast offers a wide selection and the staff were always really nice. Despite its central location our room was really quiet (we were at the front of the hotel) I would definitly recommend it and wouls have no hesitateion in booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: amnonvekill
Reviews.Content: It's our third visit of this hotel,great location,great breakfast and friendly stuff. Remember to book this hotel few months in advance so you'll get great rates for your stay,plus breakfast incl. ! (you can save up to half price...) Ask also for membership at "Mas",it's free and it will get you free newspaper in the morning, free breakfast for your partner(in case you didn't get free breakfast incl.) and possibility to check out at 4 pm. What we don't like is that the hotel charge 4€ for 1/2 hour internet (6€ for one hour). I think that this service should be free of charge. Second thing is that they don't have the possibility to make Tea/Coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic, quiet, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCountry15
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff were so helpful and the hotel room was huge (we did have a superior room). There were tea/coffee making facilities in the room which we expected but found as we travelled south to Munich & Switzerland, this wasn't the case in all the hotels. The staff happily provided a large bag or bucket of ice to us each afternoon so we could chill a few beers to enjoy in our room before heading out for the evening.There was a little supermarket close by which was handy,as we chose to have our own breakfast of museli in the room rather than pay for the buffet breakfast. The hotel was so central, we walked to all the major attractions. There are shopping centres nearby & plenty of cafes & restaurants. The only tiny negative (and its only because I like my internet fast, cheap & on tap) is the internet was free for 30minutes a day from the lobby or bar only & it could be quiet slow at times. You could pay for it in your room, but the rate was quite high.

Reviews.Title: “Mitte means middle & that's where it is!”
Reviews.Author: Phicus
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the NH Berlin Mitte for a week in December just before Christmas. We made our booking directly through the hotel & got a great promotional rate including buffet breakfast. Check-in was a breeze, the room was ready upon checkin when we arrived a little early. The room itself was small & the view was looking in on other rooms on a central cavity in the building but despite it being an older building the rooms had been recently renovated so it was pleasant. The Bed configuration was two singles pushed together with separate duvets & square pillows in the European style. TV was a small flat screen attached to the wall. The room had internet which you had to pay for which we only used briefly when trying to figure out where some restaurants were, the speed of the Internet seemed fine. Minibar was stocked with the usual but was packed so could not fit any extra goodies in (Like a schwartzbier or two). The room was very quiet despite being on a small central corridor. The bathroom was small with Shower over Bath & like most hotel bathrooms I have stayed in the bathroom floor inevitably floods but everything worked & the towels were replenished as required whilst the ones we hung up were left to re-use as is the 'eco-friendly' request. Breakfast buffet was packed each day & the wait staff seemed to be working feverishly to turn over the tables & provide pots of coffee & tea to the new restaurant inhabitants. They did well whilst constantly replenishing the buffet which saw vultures circling whenever there was an empty plate. The Food was a full continental spread with the usual hot options of a big tub of scrambled eggs etc. There was a also a chep making fresh waffles. Overall the breaskfast was good although a little manic at times. We had Room Service one night & to be honest not impressed. There are a lot of dining options around & some even better ones a short Bahn away so its our own fault for being too tired after a day of walking around Prenzlauer berg. There is plenty within a short walking distance, just around the corner is 'Kaiser's' Supermarket or snacks & Schartzbier. There is a small bakery right around ther corner as well on the way to the metro station so you can grab a quick pretzel en-route. Pharmacy is literally next door just in case & the galleries lafayette is just up the street. Of course it is right in the middle of it all with check point charlie just a block away & at Christmas time there are markets all over the place. Reception are always very helpful & The Concierge whilst not overly happy to be there was also helpful and answered any questions we had including selling train tickets etc NH Berlin Mitte seems like a Conference/Corporate hotel given the floor or two of conference space & the clientelle at the Breakfast Buffet but, was sufficient for us to enjoy Berlin & not have to travel too far to any amenities or sightseeing. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “super central”
Reviews.Author: youngman42
Reviews.Content: very nicely located business hotel, located in the heart of old (east) berlin. conveniently located to most of the sights to see. The subway connection is great going north-south or over to old west berlin, a short walk to the large street unter den linden and to the sights around the berliner dom. nice clean hotel with plain affordable no frill rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good All Rounder but better value can be found in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: infast
Reviews.Content: The hotel does what it says on the can. It is well situated. It is clean and we found it comfortable and friendly. The only negative is price. At €389 for 3 nights B&B per double room there is better value to be found.There are 3 exits/entrances to the Stadtmitte U bahn and coming back on your first night in the dark can be confusing especially as currently there are lots of roadworks in the area. I would advise people not to travel on the Berlin travel system without tickets! In our 3 night stay we saw 2 lots of fines handed out by the plain clothes inspectors. At €40 each it's not funny.

Reviews.Title: “No frills-fit for purpose place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Maud180291
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Berlin Mitte between Christmas & New Year - so prices were quite high for alot of Berlin hotels. This is a business hotel & the room wasn't really the kind of place that you wan't to spend that much time in. The room itself was small and didn't have tea & coffee making facilities & the TV was mainly German channels. The weather was cold and so were the rooms and we needed to ask for an electric heater. However, the room & bathroom were clean & the bathroom had hot water. The staff spoke excellent english & dealt well with all queries that we had. The hotel is close to Checkpoint Charlie & it was straightforward to walk across Berlin & Ubahn access was good to go on excursions outside the city/get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND LOCATION TO SEE BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: rid2000
Reviews.Content: There is a bank with an ATM across the street from the hotel. The hotel is 3 blocks north of Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Wall Museum, and an outside Checkpoint Charlie outside gallery. Potsdamer Platz is not too far of a walk if you are in good shape, or it is a very short Taxi ride. There is a grocery store, cafes, and a Starbucks all within short walking distance of the front door of the hotel. Hotel staff was very helpful on pointing which way and advising the best mode of transportation to sites. Hotel is very nice and clean. There is a German restaurant around the block in back of the hotel that is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good for buisiness, but too dry for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dimashkieh
Reviews.Content: The stay was good. The internet and other technical support were great although very expensive (around 18 Euros/day). The room was clean and cosy. They are a little slow in cleaning though. The hotel charges 22 Euros for breakfast, and it is not an extravaganza one, but this is Berlin. The best thing about the hotel is its location though it is literally on a walking distance from many attractions and metro stations. I would recommend it for business or short stay, but if I were visiting with Family on a vacation, it I too “dry” and the staff are not rude, but definitely not friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good price, nice rooms, location okay”
Reviews.Author: TakomaMan
Reviews.Content: I went with my 15-year old daughter to show her Berlin. This hotel turned out to be just fine. Nice, comfortable, clean rooms. We didn't really spend much time there, although when we did, I didn't like that we had to pay for internet service. I agree with everyone else that the location isn't great in terms of being near the subway, but it's not that far. We walked through the park to Brandenburg Gate in 15 minutes and to the Sony Center & shopping in 10. Yes, it's a business hotel and there was a big conference going on while we were there. I actually consider that a plus for the leisure traveler because the business guests are there for work and so there aren't lots of guests standing at the front desk with maps asking for directions (like we were!). I took the advice of other reviewers here and asked a few days in advance for a room near the elevator and they gave me one with no problem. My daughter liked the hotel, especially the pool.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming staff, but rooms are not up to the mark”
Reviews.Author: nobre
Reviews.Content: Pros: very welcoming staff, nice lobby and bar decoration, great location, wellness centre and, overall, excellent breakfast! Cons: standard rooms look like an old two stars hotel, cleanliness not so good both in the bathroom and in the corridors moquette.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelluver222
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, modern business hotel in an excellent location--very central to sites with Stadtmitte U-bahn station on the same block. Short walk to Checkpoint Charlie, Potsdamer Platz; longer walks or short metro ride to Brandenburg gate, Kreuzberg, pretty much any other site. We didn't have a computer with us, but used the 15 minutes of free time in the business center each of the three nights we were there. Based on others' reviews, we opted not to pay for the breakfast (although the restaurant looked very full service), but ate more cheaply elsewhere (Get a full breakfast around Potsdamer Platz or inside the Sony Center), or walk in the other direction (northeast) past the Stadtmitte station for several croissant/muffin places. One note: there are no laundromats anywhere in the area--closest is 10 minutes by taxi--so pack accordingly! We were traveling with our teenage son and they accommodated us 3 in the room, no problem. The staff all spoke fluent English. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good resturant”
Reviews.Author: hannaaase
Reviews.Content: The location is good, internett is fast (if you pay 20 euros for buisness line) and the hotell resturant is good. The price is a bit high but it`s a safe choise. Can`t se how anyone could be not happy with this hotel. You might get a cheaper one, but it`s new, modern and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Who cares if they get your booking wrong!!!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDuf
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of my friends stayed in this hotel recently and we had a really really bad customer experience on arrival. We had booked twin rooms as we were a group of male travellers. When we arrived we were given double beds and told that "that is all we have you do not have to stay if you don't want to". Our booking form clearly stated twin rooms and when I politely pointed this out to the lady at reception she literally put her hands out and shrugged her shoulders as to say "whatever". Finally at my suggestion we did a switch around and got camp beds to sort it out. At our request we got free breakfast, but on just 1 morning of our stay!!! ... again this was like pulling teeth. Hotel reception staff in hotels are one of the first interactions visitors have when they visit a city and I can safely say that this was as bad an introduction (to what is a super city) as somebody could make. I would suggest that if you want to make sure the correct room is booked for you call the hotel in advance, don't say you were not warned!! Aside from that SERIOUS black mark on arrival the hotel is clean and tidy. Location wise its ok as Mitte goes but there is not too much happening in that part of Mitte later in the evening. The guy working at the tourist information desk was excellent and gave us some great advice. Who knows .... maybe they could use him for some staff training around the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: joop1
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel for business. I must admit I recieved an exceptionally large room (394). I found staff very helpful. I requested a low floor and got a low floor (which not always the case!). Location is very good. I must admit I prefer the more cosy, charming small hotels for leisure. My opinion: for me very OK as a business client, but for leisure I prefer more charm, this is business during the week and "mass tourism" during the weekend. Breakfast very nice!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights will on a business trip to berlin. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are ok. The bed was great bar the pillow which was too soft for me. The food was good in the hotel. The hotel bar was quite while I was there and I found it hard to get a drink at times as I could not find any staff working behind the bar. It is in a good location and taxis were easy to find if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jj95tt
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend stay at this hotel on Venere for a decent price (80 or 90 Euros per night). The lobby is very nicely decorated in the modern style. We arrived at 8am after getting off the red-eye flight and did not expect that they would have a room ready for us, but were pleasantly surprised they did (they offered us a room with two single beds pushed together instead of the Double that we reserved). But we were more than happy to take that since the Double would have meant waiting longer. It was nice to freshen up so we were ready a day of sightseeing. The room is nice, with good amenities. The only complaint I have is of the shower door - it doesn't close all the way and therefore water is likely to leak on the floor. But the other hotel we stayed in Germany (Movenpick in Frankfurt) was the same way! So not sure if it's just a German style thing. The location of the hotel is very good - a few steps from the Stadtmitte metro station, and close to a number of attractions. I would recommend this hotel for sightseers and business travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin: NH Hotel Berlin-Mitte”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a Globus tour in July 2008. The hotel is very centrally located and is with in easy walking distance of restaurants, Checkpoint Charlie, a large stretch of the Berlin Wall, and the Brandenburg Gate. The only thing not in walking distance is the major shopping street of Kurfurstendamm where the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church is located, but you could easily take the subway there. There is a bank with an ATM one minutes walk from the hotel door. There is also a grocery store two minutes walk from the hotel. There is a subway stop Stadt-Mitte a three minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is modern looking. There are two sets of elevators, both fast. Our room was large and we had a view of Leipziger Strasse. There was a nice size flat screen TV in the room. The rooms have dark hardwood floors, which seem to need more sweeping/dusting because our socks were filthy after walking around in the room in the evening. The beds were comfortable. The tub/shower has the half glass panel, so water can get out into the bathroom. We had dinner (buffet with lots of choices – chicken, fish, pasta, vegetables, salad bar, deli meat, fruit, desserts) and breakfast (also buffet with lots of choices, including someone making waffles and omelets). Both were free as compliments of our tour, otherwise it would have been 20-30 Euros each for breakfast or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but dull”
Reviews.Author: TripAnorak
Reviews.Content: NH Berlin Mitte is a pretty soul-less business hotel which is functional and central, with moderately comfortable rooms and par-for-the-course service, but which has few other pluses. My one memory of staying at this hotel was the pathetically weak power shower. Fine for business if the Mandala or other hotels are full (as in my case); otherwise, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: DMR1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for business purposes and although this meant spending considerable time in taxis to get to our destination we decided to stop at the NH Berlin Mitte because of its good central location, handy for all the sites and the Christmas markets, for which Berlin is famed at this time of year. The hotel is a standard big-Euro fare hotel, but non the worse for that. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable and the reception staff speak embarrasingly good English! The only negative was that they were rennovating the dining room and bar area, so I suppose once completed, visitors will have sparkling new facilities, but it meant we were a bit cramped, particularly at breakfast, which, had I been paying for myself, I wouldn't have bothered with at 18 Euros each.

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast. Clean rooms, nothing special, but very good beds.”
Reviews.Author: hubert
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little business-like. Just like you are walking in an office-building. Rooms are not that big, but comfortable. The breakfast is very nice, but busy. Very nice priced!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City! I love the NH Hotel Mitte & I love Berlin!!”
Reviews.Author: sittinpretty71
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel, I had the pleasure to stay here for five days in July and was extremely pleased with my stay. The hotel is in a very new building and the rooms are in brand new/perfect condition. The location is sensational, in the very best part of Berlin for sightseeing, you are within 15 minutes walk of the Brandenburg Tor, Hitler's Bunker, Potsdammer Platz and its wonderful leisure facilities (Imax, English language multiplex, Sony Centre etc), also Checkpoint Charlie and the old location of the Berlin Wall. The nearest U-bahn (subway) stop is Mitte and is about a minutes walk from the hotel. The rooms were spacious and the superior room (costing 69 euro for each night - a steal!) even had a microwave oven and sink, the soundproofing from the windows was truly amazing - I think they must be quadruple glazed, not a sound from the busy road outside. The aircon also worked a treat. The staff on reception were very friendly, smiling and helpful, like most Berliners. The hotel is almost opposite the Berlin Telecommunications Museum which has had a multi million pound refit and is a wonderful (& fun) way to spend two or three hours, the three robots whizing around the visitors in the main hall are a hoot. The museum was also very quiet, no crowds! Despite wondering what I was going to do in Berlin I fell in love with the city, it is cheap compared to other Western cities, it is great fun and very down to earth & there are LOADS of things to do. Nowhere in Europe has been affected by history as much as Berlin and there are ghosts everywhere, and because of this history and the massive and almost complete regeneration I found it a very exciting place to be in and completely unpretentious and friendly. I was so pleased with this hotel and Berlin that I will visit again next year, this time for a week, which is certainly something I won't be doing with Paris which I visited last week - what a pretentious, expensive & boring mausoleum! By the way, don't bother staying in the Zoo/K-Dam area in the western part of Berlin, it is no longer the heart of the city and well past its prime, a little seedy. It was probably the place to be 30 years ago but the heart of the city has shifted a mile east since the fall of the Berlin Wall. The Mitte area is now the place to be! Also, Berlin doesn't have the hordes of London or Paris, which can become overwhelmingly stifling wihin hours of arrival, being able to wander around peaceful streets was a liberation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gremio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very nice area of Berlin. I believe this area used to be bad when the Berlin wall was still up. It is possible to walk from there to the main Berlin attractions (not a short walk though). The hotel service is average. The hotel looks very new and the room was excellent, with a nice interior design. The room was also spacious and clean. There are a couple restaurants very close by and a big shopping area at 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: nicola_1717
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Fantastic location, great food in the restaurant, staff have good command of English, but some German appreciated. Lovely rooms, throughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Wifi, okay stay”
Reviews.Author: KimGN
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few days in May by myself going to a party. The Hotel is very central, close to the old Checkpoint Charlie and very close to the central shopping avenue, Friedrichsstrasse. The lobby is loud in a strange way, so I had problems understanding what I was asked at the desk. The room was not too loud, considering that it was with the window next to the busy Leipziger Strasse. It is a new business-persons hotel with (I assume) all facilities that one can ask for. And the price as well. At more than 150€ pr. night, one does not expect to be charged 6€ for a bottle of water and 17€ pr. day wifi. The brochures claimed that internet was free on cable, but not ethernet outlet was present in the room, then offering only a very uncomfortable high-priced, but well-working Wifi (I guess at about 2 Mbit.) The limit of 400 MB downloads pr. day may or may not be reasonable considering the price. I had dinner at the hotel one night and it was nice, although the vintages on the wine list didn't match what was served and the waitress, who was nice by all other standards, did not know much about the content of the wines. They ought to have in-house tastings to become better at that. The wine list was primarily Spanish and German and seemed both fair and varied. The room was clean and kept very tidy during my stay and even reasonable sized with a good number of facilities, although I missed a trousers press (which would be fair for this kind of hotel). There was a Playstation 2 in the room or something similar, but each game was 5€ or more, so I was glad I brought my Mac (which contrary to popular belief has a few games onboard ;-)) I could be coming back for: - the room itself. - the Wifi (if it was free). - the general service level. - the okay hotel restaurant. I will probably skip it because of: - The super-expensive WIFI. - The super-expensive console game - The super-expensive bottle of water, that made me avoid even looking at the minibar. A hit or a miss? If somebody else pays: a hit, if you pay yourself, a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and practical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Livinginspain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in march and were upgraded as the options we requested were not available. The room was very functional although I would have liked to see the lower class rooms as ours wasnt fantastic. The good thing about NH is that you always know what you are getting, with slight adaptations to the local habits. The great thing about this hotel is it's location: 300 yards from Checkpoint Charlie and in walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate, the museums and Alexander platz and al lot of shops! Very convienent for Schonefeld airport, too! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Cara-TRIP
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed in this hotel over the New Year Bank Holiday Weekend. The communal areas were swanky and welcoming and without exception the staff were very friendly, booking taxis to the airport and giving helpful tips thoughout our stay etc It was the little touches that really made my impression of the hotel. We were due to check out on New Year's Day and were allowed to keep our rooms until 3pm without additional charge. In addition the brunch on our last day was extended until 2pm to allow for a lie in after the inevitable big night out before. They even let us put the english footie on in the bar until we went to the airport. The breakfast was plentiful and varied. The rooms were amazingly clean, comfy and well stocked (lots of storage space, hangers, hairdryer, sat TV, free safe, lots of mirrors, freebie toiletries) The location was perfect, we got one tube during the entire trip and walked everywhere else. I would certainly stay again and would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “eh... could have been better”
Reviews.Author: amgdharper
Reviews.Content: It was in a terrific location. The hotel was really pretty. The resturant was really nice.... yummy food. When you got to the actual room though it was a little too frigid and uncomfortable. The beds were nice, but kind of stark. I would stay here again though. The staff was really nice and helped with our maps.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: currypata
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a bit disappointing-no frills almost like a youth hostel.However the communal areas were ok

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: alymccal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Berlin Mitte for a weekend break to Berlin with a friend. The hotel was clean and above the usual travel inn, ibis hotels i usually stay in for city breaks... the hotel is only 200m from the underground station and as with lots of european cities it was very easy to navigate our way around. The hotel is very close to checkpoint charlie and a 5-10 minute walk from other major sites. I would say most people staying at the hotel are there on business however we found all the staff to be more than helpful to a couple of 30 somethings visiting the sights and the nightlife. Not sure what the food was like, but the restaurant looked busy - if you have a choice and arent a huge breakfast person - avoid it as within 100m of hotel near underground stop are the usual starbucks, and german cafes for kaffe and kuchen, or coffee and cake... much cheaper and just as tasty as the hotel (i imagine) also just along past the underground is a mini market selling all the nibbles you need - if you want to avoid the expensive mini bar costs. As for the hotel itself, it was spotless, quiet (although on a busy street), air con, rooms tidied daily with the extra toiletry samples missing in the more budget hotel options. I would stay again if visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Toofaraway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nh Berlin-Mitte Hotel for two nights in late August, 2006. The hotel is modern and located in what was formerly East Berlin, so the surrounding area still bears some of the effects of many years of communist control. In the past few years, however, the area has undergone extensive development in certain areas. The hotel is convenient to the Friedrichstrasse shopping district and some other Berlin sites, such as Checkpoint Charlie. The hotel itself is attractive, the rooms are of ample size, clean, modern and comfortable. The restaurant offers good food. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return if in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay”
Reviews.Author: NDP
Reviews.Content: The NH Berlin Mitte is outstanding. This four star superior hotel has everything you need in a city hotel. My room was very spacious, stylishly, decorated and very quiet. There was a comfortable leather chair to relax in and plenty of cupboard space. Breakfast was rather expensive, but there is a Starbucks and a bakery less than 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Jeff
Reviews.Content: Many good things about the NH Mitte. First- GREAT LOCATION. The hotel is around the corner from the Stadmitte U-Bahn stop, which makes it easy to get around the city. It is also near Checkpoint Charlie, the old Luftwaffe headquarters and the Holocaust Memorial and within walking distance (30-40 minutes) to the Reichstag nad Brandenberug Gate. The rooms are clean, modern and hotel is in a quite part of town, however the bed was a bit thin and lumpy. However after walking all day long, it didn't take much for me to fall asleep. Breakfast is also expensive, and I did not find a nearby restaurant to get breakfast. All in all, a solid choice, allbeit a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scott-71
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value,great location close to checkpoint Charlie and Alexanderplatz ,also just round the corner from subway,the staff were freindly and our room was a good size.would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable hotel room bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Morag4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights when in Berlin for the Love Parade. Fantastic location, very friendly staff, but most notable of all it had the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in in a hotel.....Rooms were a good size, and very clean. Didn't have breakfast, it seemed a bit overpriced at 16 euros, especially considering the number of great cafes in the area. The only negative thing I could say about this hotel was the lack of tea/coffee making factlities in the room....what can I say, I'm British. Other than that,Berlin is a brilliant city. We will certainly return, to both Berlin and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the city centre. There is an underground station nearby and it's just a couple of minutes' walk to a lot of sights such as Checkpoint Charlie, Potsdamer Platz, Deutscher Dom, Brandenburger Tor etc. Breakfast was great and the rooms are spacious and very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. If we go to Berlin again we will definitly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, good quality for money”
Reviews.Author: Axeman21
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for a 4 night stay with me wife in Berlin after reading the good reviews here. And it was a good decision. The Hotel is perfectly located close to the Subwaystation "Stadtmitte" that takes you to several places like the Potsdamer Platz, Friedrichstrasse or Hackesche Höfe in a matter of minutes. And you can even just walk to the Potsdamer Platz in 10 - 15 min. Great! The rooms are very nice, especially if you have a room facing the courtyard and not the street. The service is good. One downside we were watching is the bar. There was only one lady that had some skills in making drinks the right way, but two others also tried to do that and made some very big mistakes mixing a drink. That's why we can't recommend going to the bar if you want to have a mixed drink. But for a beer, .. its wonderfull and looks great! We'd stay there again!

HotelInfo.Name: NH Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Leipziger Strasse 106-111, 10117 Berlin, Germany
